result.execSummary:
The defendant James P Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fulltime employment, schooling, or a combination of at least 30 hours per week and if not, then perform 10 hours community service per week.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
Probation may be transferred to Wood Co.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James P Reed

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:30 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, pro se.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 6 months probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; no contact with G.D.; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days credit if revoked. 
COURT authorizes transfer of probation to Wood County. 

Adj: 1:39 am

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:13 am 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person, pro se. 
Date and time was set for hearing on deft's waiver of Atty before jury trial. 
State notes parties have reached an agreement and requests plea hearing be set for a later date as there are victim's rights to be addressed first. 
Clerk provides deft with waiver of atty and plea forms. 
COURT removes jury trial and advises parties to see JA to set plea hearing. 
Bond continues. 
Adj: 10:16 pm

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:01 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person, pro se. 
Date and Time set for FPT. 
State notes parties have not reached an agreement and notes deft wishes to proceed without counsel to jury trial. 
COURT questions deft regarding proceeding pro se. 
Deft states he was not eligible for public defender and not found indigent. 
Deft is uncertain about hiring counsel on his own. 
COURT questions deft regarding waiving right to counsel. 
COURT notes jury trial will remain on at this time. 
Adj: 2:04 pm

No contact with victim(s):  G.D.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.
